Which statement correctly defines odd and even parity in the context of a parity check?
options: Odd parity means the number of 1s is even; even parity means the number of 1s is odd.
Odd parity means the total number of 1s is odd; even parity means the total number of 1s is even.
Odd parity and even parity both require the same total number of 1s.
Odd parity applies only to blocks, not single bytes.
questions.answer: Odd parity means the total number of 1s is odd; even parity means the total number of 1s is even.

questions.question: What is a stated limitation of a single-byte parity check?
options: It cannot detect any single-bit error.
It cannot be used with even parity.
If an even number of bits are in error, the overall parity can remain the same and the error may not be detected.
It cannot be recalculated at the receiver.
questions.answer: If an even number of bits are in error, the overall parity can remain the same and the error may not be detected.

questions.question: Match each method to its defining description.

pairs.parity block: A horizontal and vertical parity check used together to identify the bit in error, after which that bit is corrected or the block re-sent
pairs.checksum: A verification value calculated using an agreed method, sent with the data, and recomputed at the receiver to verify the block
pairs.echo check: Data sent back by the receiver for comparison; a match suggests correct transmission, a difference indicates an error

questions.question: Match each data entry error type to its description.

pairs.wrong digits: A digit is entered incorrectly or replaced by another digit
pairs.transpositions of two digits: Two adjacent digits are swapped during entry
pairs.missing or extra digits: A digit is omitted or an additional digit is inserted

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a check digit?
options: To detect errors in data entry
questions.answer: To detect errors in data entry

questions.question: Automatic repeat request uses an _____ from the receiver to confirm that data was delivered correctly.
What does a timeout represent in ARQ?
options: The time taken to send the data
The time allowed to elapse before an acknowledgement is received
The maximum data block length allowed
The delay before starting a transmission
questions.answer: The time allowed to elapse before an acknowledgement is received

questions.question: Match each step in the automatic repeat request process to its description.

pairs.start timer on send: The sender transmits a packet and begins measuring a waiting period
pairs.positive acknowledgement received: The sender is informed that delivery was successful
pairs.timeout expires: No confirmation arrives within the waiting period
pairs.re-send packet: The sender transmits the same packet again
